text:
I was looking for a simple way to try out scripts and functions, without 
needing to connect to an external server (HTTP, FTP etc).

I took the simplest sampler I could find (Java SleepTest) and added parameters 
to define various additional values in the response object:

 * - responseCode
 * - responseMessage
 * - Label
 * - success/fail status

Hopefully this will be useful to others when developing test scripts and 
experimenting with the features of JMeter.

Code and a sample test script to follow.
creator: tjsb@slb.com
tjsb@slb.com
text:
Created attachment 6649
JavaTest.jmx - test file for JavaTest java sampler

creator: tjsb@slb.com
text:
The attached code also optionally sets up the SamplerData and ResposeData fields

See JMX file for usage sample.

creator: tjsb@slb.com
text:
Thanks very much for adding this in.

Unfortunately, I've just discovered what may be a bug in it:

The default values for SleepTime and SleepMask are different from those used by 
the SleepTest Java sampler. It appears that the JavaTest values are being used 
as defaults for SleepTest (alphabetical order?). This also applies to the Java 
Defaults page.

Not sure whether this is a bug in JavaTest (should not be using the same 
parameter name) or perhaps in another part of JMeter.

But an obvious and simple fix is to change JavaTest to rename the parameters.

Patch to follow which renames the parameters (and replaces two occurences of 
literal strings with their constant names - oops!)

creator: tjsb@slb.com
text:
Created attachment 6681
Change names of Sleep parameters

Created attachment 6736
JavaTest_name2.patch - corrected patch - replaces 6681
creator: tjsb@slb.com

text:
Updated patch 6681 (Change names of Sleep parameters) to allow for recent 
JavaDoc changes.
creator: tjsb@slb.com
